name: 藝術與東方文化
comment: 上課教室：美術系館203教室；授課教師：莊坤良老師
description:
本課程以全英語授課，目的在於使學生掌握以國際語言發表討論東方藝術文化的正確語彙知識與技能。將討論中國、日本、韓國及印度等地的藝術文化如何在其時代背景下發展。
This course will use English as a medium of instruction (EMI) and its aim is to equip students with sufficient English knowledge and skills to discuss art and the Oriental civilization in appropriate English. Chinese, Japanese, Korean and Indian cultures will be discussed in the context of how art has been developing in these countries.
goals: To gain knowledge about art and Oriental civilization.
To promote creative and critical thinking skills
To discuss issues about art and oriental cultures in appropriate English.
syllabus:
**Weekly schedule**

**1.Introduction**

**2\. “ Laozi’s philosophy of non-action” pp.13-22**

**3\. “Eco-awareness in traditional Chinese culture” pp. 43-54**

**4\. “The eternal smile of the Buddha” pp.119-128**

**5\. “Flying strokes of calligraphy” pp. 129-136**

**6\. “Porcelain—calling card of Chinese culture”  pp. 137-146**

**7\. “Gardens South of the Yangtze River”  pp. 147-158**

**8\. “Peking opera: Artistry of Performers” pp.159-170**

**9\. “Life with fragrant tea”pp. 215-226**

**10\. mid-term exam**

**11\. Japanese aesthetics**

**12\. What is wabi sabi? (** **https://www.tofugu.com/japan/wabi-sabi/)**

**13\. Korean art and literature**

**14\. Korean design and popular cultures**

**15\. Indian cultures** (**http://www.everyculture.com/Ge-It/India.html)**

**16\. Indian paintings** (**https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian\_painting)**

**17\. Oral presentation**

**18\. Final projects due**

methodologies.note: The teacher will give lectures on certain themes in art history and oriental civilization.
Students will be asked to form different groups and discuss the issues in the textbook.
We will visit some art exhibitions and interview international artists.
Online resources will be used for reading and group discussion.
Students will be asked to choose one topic of their own interests in art for their final presentation.
